cinnamon.engine.utils

Class RepositionableTestSuite

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.utils.RepositionableTestSuite

  • public class RepositionableTestSuite
extends java.lang.Object

    Provides a set of (x,y,z) with all permutations of different types of floating point values to test against.

    This set covers the following types: zeros (positive and negative zeros are not differentiated), +- infinity, NaN, and finite non-zero positive and negative numbers. Unlike the other types of values, when a finite non-zero positive or negative number is needed in a permutation, the number is randomly chosen.

    Tests wanting to cover these values should call generatePermutations(Repositionable, Runnable, Random) and pass the actual test's operations in as a Runnable.

    • Method Detail

      • assertEquals

        public static void assertEquals(Repositionable expected,
                                Repositionable actual)

        Asserts that the given actual Repositionable has the exact same values (floating point delta of 0) as the expected one. This method cannot be used to assert that two Repositionals are both null.

        Parameters:
        expected - expected.
        actual - actual.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either expected or actual is null.

      • copyPositionFromTo

        public static void copyPositionFromTo(Repositionable from,
                                      Repositionable to)

        Copies the position values from one Repositionable to another.

        Parameters:
        from - source.
        to - target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either from or to is null.

      • generatePermutations

        public static void generatePermutations(Repositionable container,
                                        java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                                        java.util.Random rng)

        Executes the Runnable multiple times with each execution having a different combination of different kinds of x, y, and z values (+0, infinity, etc) for the given Repositionable. The test method should be called in Runnable.run() and expect that the given Repositionable's values are changed between executions of the Runnable.

        Parameters:
        container - to test.
        runnable - testing operation.
        rng - random number generator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either container, runnable, or rng is null.

      • getValueOfType

        public static float getValueOfType(int type,
                                   java.util.Random rng)

        Gets the value corresponding with the given range [0,VALUE_TYPE_COUNT]. Value identifiers are as follows.

        • 0 : +-0
        • 1 : Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY
        • 2 : Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY
        • 3 : Float.NaN
        • 4 : all other values within the test case's range
        Parameters:
        type - value identifier
        rng - random number generator.
        Returns:
        value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if random number generator is null.
